review: A place suited for those trying to fill some time before a flight or get their drink on. Small but has booths and seating at the bar both have food options. Friendly bartender he will ask where you are traveling too?  If you buy a beer (two sizes) get a shot for $5.00 at the bar but know before tip it will be about $16.00.  The bartender was nice enough and even called you by name as you left and "to have a good flight".

For WHAT IT IS (an express, sit down restaurant in an airport)? 5 stars. Here's why: My waitress was delightful and smiled the whole time; but not fake sweet.  I was sat within minutes and had coffee very soon thereafter.  The hostess was constantly wiping things down and being attentive.  My food was EXACTLY as ordered: scrambled eggs, toast, home fries and bacon for approximately $10.59. Plus, coffee was hot and tasted fine.  This morning, my expectations were not only met but exceeded by the staff and service.

The food was mediocre. As an avid chillis fan, I was expecting  at least decent, warm food. Instead I got a plate of cold eggs, cold toast and potatoes that felt like they had been left under a warmer for an hour. Not a single piece of food on my plate was above lukewarm.  While I was eating, one member of the staff yelled "*Insert name here* COME DO YOUR JOB!" The employee then walked to the front and proceeded to inform the customer "Sorry, my wait staff is lazy."  My waiter was great although it was a short stay.  Overall, the food was mediocre and the service was poor. For a $16 plate of eggs and potatoes, at least deliver warm food and don't insult your co-workers in front of customers.
This is a good place to grab a quick bite and to kill time when you're waiting for a flight.
Terrible food. We had breakfast here and paid top dollars for food out of a refrigerator. Scrambled eggs, pan cakes, fries... None of them were fresh. Service is pretty bad too.

Terrible. Chili's should be ashamed of the level of service provided to their customers.  I've sat at the bar for 15 minutes, not a single person at this bar has a drink in front of them, and the bartender is fumbling around lost.  I haven't seen anyone even order a beverage yet. Perhaps it's a staff training issue, a manning issue, or a competency issue but customers should not be asked to bear the brunt of any of those problems. I can't wait until the food shows up.  From what I can see of the kitchen, I'm keeping my expectations low.

I get it.  We're not supposed to like Chili's.  It's a crappy chain. But this place was actually decent, especially since it was directly across from my gate. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich (chicken breast with applewood smoked bacon, fresh sliced tomato, lettuce, Swiss cheese & honey-mustard) and it was tastier than I expected. The fries were a little overcooked, though. The guy next to me got chips and salsa.  Were those complimentary?  If so, why didn't I get any? Whatever.  I had to catch a flight. Look man, you can do worse than this place.  You can also do better.  It's an airport.  Suck it up and deal.

This use to be such an avg Chilis and a nice treat to get an El Presidente marg before my American flights.  This last time the service was a disaster. No acknowledgement for 10 minutes...i actually just waited and didnt say anything to see how long it would go...or how many servers would pass me by.  Two others sat near me in the bar area and the mgr helped and got their drink orders but not mine...he just got me a menu and said someone would be with me soon.  They did not and I bounced. No Presidente for me today...or anytime in the foreseeable future. Boybye.

I've come to expect not-so-great airport food, so this Chili's was a pleasant surprise. I ordered off the "lighter entree" menu (Thank you Chili's!) - mango salsa chicken, which came with cilantro rice and broccoli. The chicken was well cooked and juicy. The kids menu was good as well. I really appreciate that you could substitute broccoli for fries (thankfully my kid likes broccoli). The lunch felt very healthy and well balanced. The best part was how quickly our food was served. Service was prompt and polite. We were in and out in 30 minutes, which is great for an airport location. I'll be back next time we're at the D Gates at SeaTac!

Waited 20 mins for someone to get our order. Waited for 30 mins for some dry and bland food. And waited for 15 minutes for a cheese cake that wasn't even thawed and wasn't even explained to us by the wairess. And she insisted that she told us but she said previously that she will "check" if cheesecakes are available.

This was a nice oasis in the middle of canceled flight chaos. Except they were "out" of nachos. Also, it's not a full chilis, they didn't have steak or the normal menu. This is like a half chilis. Good enough though.
This place is HORRIBLE. The stupid waitress wouldn't accept my driver's license. I'm 24 years old and have a valid, non expired ID.  HORRIBLE service

If this wasn't the only option in terminal D, it would be have long ago went out of business. Absolutely horrible experience thanks in large part to Danielle the "shift manager" who has no business card or direct contact number. I left with a piece of receipt paper with her name and date written on it when I asked for a way to complain. She was incredibly rude and the whole experience was ridiculous. I would love to speak with one of her managers about the experience... Avoid this place at all costs

When you eat here you risk missing your flight. And it doesn't matter how much time you think you have. I'm confident they can make you miss it. In all seriousness I think you need to be here 1 HR before your flight so if you get held up at security look else where.  Food is so-so. Took 5 min to get seat with half the tables open. Some people waited up to 15min after I got seated.  Then took 10 min to get my drink order ordered.  Which luckily I was ready to order food.  I'm currently waiting for the food.  I've eaten here before so I know the food quality and I know what to expect. For airport food it's ok (only ever had the breakfast) The bacon is so thin that I now get the sausage.  The customer service is literally the pits when you are at the dang airport and obviously time is important.  Chilis needs to kick their people in the pants at this location.

This place sucks, took me 30 min to get my food and when I finally got my salad, I took a single taste and the lettuce was so bad, was the same taste of the lettuce when have like 2 weeks sitting in the fridge...old and crispyless. After the food, the service was not too bad...

They get 1 star for getting my food out to me quickly. Chilis is my favorite restaurant and I've eaten the original chicken crispers a million times. Their chicken crispers are just chicken fingers. They tasted like something you would find at a ball park or the freezer section at the grocery store. Wasn't expecting something like that or I wouldn't have ordered it. Not the same at all. The broccoli it came with was steamed probably for 30 seconds. Very hard and unseasoned. Not impressed. It's sad to think some people might eat chilis here for the first time and end up hating it.
Breakfast food was good, but no decaf and no grape jelly! Missing breakfast essentials.
Ignored at the desk for about ten minutes. Gave up went to the bar. No beers on tap, no queso, and rude service. 0 stara

I spend too much time in airports and eating in airports.  I rarely end up in this terminal though.  There isn't anything bad about this place, there just isn't really anything good either...it's a Chilis made to be less than what is already mediocre and in an airport...definitely modify your expectations.  The menu is pretty small, mostly sandwiches and burgers.  I think they have one soup option and a couple of salads.  Full bar (?).  The service was fine.  It was nice being right next to my gate and on the "patio" so I could hear when boarding was starting.   It's definitely not the worst place in the SeaTac airport.

Sorry, I hate to be so negative but this place is below average.  I know it's the airport and you can't be picky because it's convenient. My husband and I had bloody Mary's and they were nasty, the celery was a tiny and squishy.  I ordered a plate of fresh fruit and it was discolor we, squishy and over ripe by about 1 week.  The bartender returned no questions ask!

This place needs needs new management and employees who know how to multitask.  This by far was the worst Chili's I have ever dined at. They also don't honor the Chili's email offers or Chili's rewards. First off, the greeter seemed way overworked and apparently was also required to buss tables, so she couldn't keep up with the front counter customers as well as handling to-go orders. After being sat at a semi clean table, we waited for about 10 min before anyone came by. The waitress was busy and appeared to only be able to handle only one table at a time. Thinking it would speed up our order, we were gave our complete order so we could make our flight on time. We received our chips and salsa and drinks fairly quick but things turned bad after. Waited another 15 min before our other apps came out, which was only soups and only got 2 of the 3 ordered. Our main course came our about 15 min after that. It was pretty difficult to even get some drink refills. I understand why they have a quick menu but food was taking way to long to come out.  Unless you have a couple hours between flights, and enjoy waiting, I would suggest to skip this place.

How long will you have to sit here before your waitress comes back to take your drink order after she walked away with the menu? If you're me you're going to have to ask another waitress to get her. You're going to order a grey goose & soda with extra lime, and you're going to get one crusty lime.  There are other restaurants/bars in this airport.

Not sure why they branded this place as a Chili's because Chili's it is not.  The food was mediocre but hey, what do you expect from an airport?  It seemed like they just wanted to get you in and out fast, which I guess is good for travelers who are in a rush.  But I wasn't.  I would have at least liked to have my drink re-filled or asked if I wanted to see a dessert menu (like they do at a regular Chili's).  But no, my check was just placed on my table shortly after my Buffalo Chicken sandwich came out.  Oh well, I guess this is better than the opposite (slow service with a flight leaving soon).

Stopped here while waiting for my flight back to Cali.  The server was very nice, but I had to ask her for things more than once most times.  The menu is very limited for obvious reasons, but the food was hot and fresh when it came out.  Considering their customers are those waiting for (or trying to catch) flights I found all aspects of the service to be slow--from seating, to taking orders, and giving refills. If you don't have at least an hour before boarding begins, I'd skip this one and eat somewhere else.  If you have the time, it's not a bad option.
I waited quite a while to be seated while they were not busy. My server took 15 minutes to take my drink order. In other words, go elsewhere if you want faster service

Pretty good visit here. Waitress was friendly and the hostess was able to get us seated quickly. Nothing really vegetarian/vegan on the menu here but the staff accommodated for my wife. For a little airport shop I would say my visit was better than I expected. Nice to have some familiar food that tastes good when traveling.

Very busy spot, understaffed. Only saw two waitresses serving the whole place and every seat was filled. The menu is extremely limited here: limited appetizers, no spinach dip, no Trio option, expensive entrees compared to regular Chili's restaurants. Ordered the boneless buffalo wings and they were a bit burned, barely any buffalo sauce tossed in, had to settle for ranch since they were out of bleu cheese. Disappointing meal that took too long to come out but understandable considering the amount of patrons ahead of me. Perhaps something management can work on in the future (staffing). I was craving the boneless wings; in hindsight, there are far more suitable options in this airport.

I know airport restaurants aren't meant to be amazing, but this place is just down right awful. Service was slow, inattentive, and kept forgetting things I had asked for. The menu is also very limited. They don't even have chicken crispers! Don't bother eating here.

Well, it's really the only thing this far down in the terminal, so it's great to grab a beer while still watching your gate, with the understanding that: The beer selection is VERY limited. The "best" option was Alaskan Amber.  Said beers are very expensive. After tax and a decent tip, my big beer was $12.  Decent tip because my server was pretty darn quick, which was great, because I've really struggled with very slow and overloaded service at some of the other airport bars.

This Chili's is definitely the best Chili's within 50 feet of gate D7. So it has that going for it.  Since it is located in the airport, and a far trek from competition with Starbucks and McDonald's, the restaurant essentially has a captive audience. This explains why I paid $12 for lukewarm scrambled egg tacos with no flavor.  Bonus points for the cockroach we watched running up and down the wall along the booth while we waited for our food. :)

This was, by far, the worst Chili's I've ever been to.  Main reason - THEY SERVED ME FOOD ON PAPER PLATES!  I'm sorry I was at a sit down restaurant correct?  It was absurd and it made me unhappy.  I have eaten at many other Chilis in other airports, as well as Fridays and other airport establishments, and they use actual plates and cutlery. The service was also abysmal.  Max there were 5 other people there, and we sat for about 10 minutes after we were completely done with our food before I was able to flag down the waitress to bring us our check.  Maybe outside of an airport this works, but we have flights to catch!  Gotta be on top of these things. As far as the food goes, it was fine.  We were there for breakfast.  I had eggs and pancakes.  It was nothing special and the sour taste in my mouth from the other problems far outweighed my minor satisfaction with the food. I wouldn't recommend going here.

Worst service ever!  They basically ignore you.  I actually had to put my arm out to stop a waiter to get our bill.  When I asked about ordering dessert they told me they didn't know anything about the deserts and to ask the bar tender.  It's almost like they went out of there way to ignore us!  Very strange!

Son of a bitch. After eating here, I can official say "this taste like shit" when eating something bad cuz when people say "oh you've eaten shit before?" I would say yeah, I actually ate at chilli's too in Seattle airport. Eating their chicken enchilada soup took 2 years off of my life which is cool cuz living in a world where a place like this exists isn't worth it. I got my garden salad on a hot plate so there's that. Customer service level: all the employees just found out they are having a kid and their minds are just lost in thought about what the fuck they are going to actually do about it.

Be ready for a wait! Located in the Seattle airport. Was catching a flight back to la when mom and I came across this chili's.  Waited abt 40 min. Not good if you were catching a connecting flight.  Short staffed, but very accomodating. The employees did the best they could.   Restaurant clean, food tasted like usual Chili's food. Had a  burger and salad.  Good quality.  What was thumbs down was the plastic utensils the food was served on and the wait.  But heh, food was good and staff was very cool.

Waitress waited 20 minutes to get me a menu. Then came back after 30 minutes to get my order. When I ordered a sandwich they told me the kitchen was closer. Worst customer service ever with callous servers who spend more time hanging around than working. Wouldn't recommend that anyone waste their time going here. 50 minute waste of time.

Seriously sad place. I know, I know super chain restaurant at an airport. But come on! People waiting for tables---and there were empty tables all over the place. Yes, small restaurant so a party of 8 isn't going to work very well. But what about a couple or a single guest? Nothing except there were 7 empty tables for two spread through the place. The host kept talking about the need to wait on the list for the groups. Apparently, a group is 2 or more. Fine, seat the couples. Nope just more empty tables opening up. I seriously think the manager should be summarily terminated along with the host(ess). I haven't even gotten to the "food" offerings.

I will never eat here again! The service is terrible! Waited forever just to get acknowledged to put our name in!  This is the second time this happened, different locations.  Is this a standard for this establishment? Also ordered two sodas and boneless wings and the waitress rolled her eyes at us. I guess we didn't order enough food so that she can get a good tip??? We waited for a half hour for one order of boneless wings! I AM DONE GIVING THIS PLACE MY MONEY.

The only reason i gave this 1 star is so i could write the review.  I went to this restaraunt to have lunch and wait on my flight which wasnt due for 2 hours.  I stood at the desk for 20 minutes before someone came to take my name for a seat.  I was given a seat fairly quickly but it was at the bar and i had to leave my bag against the wall.  I had a seat and ordered a beer.  I told the girl i needed to order food.  20 minutes later i had to ask again for a menu.  She brought the menu and i ordered one small bowl of chili.  Three more peple came in and sat down and she made us all use the same menu instead of getting menus for the others.  After another 40 minutes and watching the others get their meals, i asked if i could get my chili.  She went back to the kitchen and brought me a bowl of COLD chili and a fork.  By this time it was time for me to board.  I aske for a refund.  The giirl had disappeared and nobody knew how to refund my money.  I asked for a manager.  10 minutes later i was told the manager was on the way and he would refund my money.  The manager never showed up.  They foynd the waitress and she did refund my chili but did not refund the tip.  I paid $18 for a bowl of cold chili and a tip for the person who did not bring my order (she went to break and never told anyone i had food )  the food came late, the food was cold, they didnt refund my money, and the manager never arrived.  I love chilis but i will be sure to tell anyone headed to this airport to stay away from this one.  It will be a long time before i ever eat at one again.

I should have looked at reviews before I stopped here. I decided to eat here because it is a restaurant I eat at while I am home. However this was one of my worst experiences at a chain restaurant. Food was terrible. How much does it cost or how long does it take to season a burger? Salt and pepper can't be that hard to sprinkle. The service was worse than my food. The girls need to talk as to not allow the guest to be able to here there weekend plans and talk about wanting to close. If you are in SeaTac airport eat somewhere else.

I have to admit that other than eventually getting to wherever I'm going, Chili's is my favorite part of going to SeaTac Airport.  I know Seattle's legislation makes it difficult for chain restaurants to move in and that's probably a good thing, but I have to say I REALLY miss Southwestern egg rolls.  They're good here, if pricier than they would be at a regular Chili's.  I've also had a burger here, and even though they have to cook it to well-done at this location, it happily was NOT burnt to a crisp.  Service has always been friendly, and they have a decent selection of on-tap beer. It's competing with other in-airport restaurants competing for your trapped-past-security-so-willing-to-pay-for-over-priced-food businesses, but all in all not so bad.  I'm willing to trek over here for lunch when I have time, and I usually fly out of B.  Recommended.

Well, 2:00 in the afternoon before a 5 o'clock  flight to Maui, plenty of time, I want chips, salsa and a beer from chili's! It's the only Chilis on the west side of the cascade's I better go! Closed !!! What!!!!

Limited menu, paper plates, plastic forks, slow service. Just don't do it. Well, maybe a burger, those looked ok. But the salad was soggy and way overdressed. Even with low expectations I was disappointed.
Slow, lame food. Below average beer selection, no pricing on some menu items. Could care less about the food.
Food sucked ,service sucked. I was hoping for more but was disappointed . That being said better than McDonald's worse than Wendy's. Sub par burgers.

I'm not sure why this is a 2 but the service I had was great.  There was one mistake with my order but the bartender Skyler took care if me immediately... Customer device is still alive.. And the good was great too!!!!

no stars because that is what it deserves. I dont see it being open much longer. Service was horrible, I was discussing with my husband "How did these employees get hired?" Food was awful, I had them take my food back and refund my money. What a shame seatac

Service was ok but the breakfast is just nasty. The sausage patties taste like I image what dog food tastes like. Microwave eggs and weak coffee. There's a reason the waiter is encouraging you to get hot sauce. It's to mask the taste of this stuff.
Chicken taste like frozen sorry.

7/19 Chicken ranch with blue cheese subbed for ranch.  Good, fresh and pretty good quality.  It's just too bad that this place has such limited hours.  I have been here numerous times for late afternoon / early evening flights only to find it closed.
Service is poor!  5 minutes and no one at the table.  Hear that food orders are backed up.  I know it's an airport location but service could be much better.

Hubby and I both ordered the breakfast tacos. They each came with two tortillas filled with scrambled eggs, cheese, and pico. It came with a side of breakfast potatoes (we think they are the steak fries cut into nuggets) and your choice of bacon or sausage. We both chose the bacon and it was cooked just right - crispy! Our server was super nice (I hate that I never remember names) and even gave us to-go lids for our iced teas. Good service & good food!

Ok limited airport menu...limited space...I get it.   Great prices and all the standard Chilis offerings...burgers, salads, boneless wings, southwestern egg rolls.   Service was great...thanks Skyler!  Glad we went here and will be back.

I almost NEVER write reviews, but the service here was soooo bad that I just had to. So my husband and I were trying to grab a meal before our flight home, we saw Chil's Too and thought it was a good idea. WRONG!!!. First off, there were this family ahead of us and wanted a table, but the hostess (which he was also a server) kept trying to tell the family to sit at the bar table that faces the terminal seating. So the family said, no..we'll wait for a table. Then the hostess goes..'ugh fine". Then it was our turn and we got seated to a table fairly quickly, but of course, without menus. So a waiter walks by with menus from another table that he just took orders from..I stopped him and nicely asked if we can have some menus. He puts them on the table and walks away. He walks by me again and I politely ask "excuse me, can we order?" and he rudely puts up his index finger at me and said.."I'm not ready for you!" Even the customer sitting at another table gave a look at what happened. Mind you, it was not busy...we saw other waiters just literally standing around and picking their nails.  So instead of sitting through the rudeness and risking the chance of them spitting in our food..we lugged our luggage and ate somewhere else where they were nice and understands that people have a flight to catch. Note to self: make sure you eat before going to the airport.  Good job, Chiil's Too.

I ordered the breakfast tacos and I wish I would have ordered something else. They were very watery which I wasn't sure if it was the eggs not cooked enough or the too much salsa poured on top. The service on the other hand was excellent. Very fast and super friendly.
